Hi Adrian,

Yes I do, feedback received so far from IT admins is that the test build that was deployed or installed on endpoints having the audio issues are all working fine  now.

So, it seems the test build resolved the issue related to audio devices.

Kind Regards

Jovan Salsone

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000FfR22:ref


Good Day,

Just an update on the below.

The test build was installed on one computer to see if it helped with the audio issue experienced. It helped to a certain extent; I am still not 100% confident that this issue is related to Endpoint Protector.

I have asked that the agent be uninstalled on one of the machines experiencing this issue to see if it is linked. Have you had any of you other customers report this issue recently? Is it possible that installing the agent with no active policy can impact or corrupt any driver (audio drivers to be exact)?

Kind Regards

Jovan Salsone

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com<mailto:techsupport@netwrix.com>>
Sent: Thursday, September 12, 2024 2:38 PM
To: Salsone, Jovan <Jovan.Salsone@psi-cro.com<mailto:Jovan.Salsone@psi-cro.com>>
Subject: RE: Netwrix Support Ticket #420807 - - Audio Devices [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0FfR22:ref ]

Dear Jovan,

Our R&D team made some improvements regarding the reported situation with the audio devices.

We prepared a test build to see if the problem is still reproducing with those improvements.
Please note: this in only a test build and should only be installed on a single machine to try to reproduce this issue.
https://download.endpointprotector.com/custom_agent/Epp15072024/EPPClient_v6.2.4.0003.zip

Please provide me a feedback after you try it


Best regards,

Adrian Draghici |Technical Support Team Lead (EMEA/Asia/Aus)

TextBody:
Dear Jovan,

Thank you again for your feedback! This fix will be included in the official client from our very next release - 5941.
We do not have an exact date for this version release but I would say that it would become available somewhere at the beginning of December.

Best regards,

Adrian Draghici |Technical Support Team Lead (EMEA/Asia/Aus)
